002_PostDuel.synopsis: Two nobles in Jannath Estate argue and finally come to blows. This oneliner is for if AngryNoble_002 is the survivor or if both nobles were calmed down. This noble was the one who purchased the fake painting.
002_PostDuel.how_to_trigger: 1) Players get close to arguing nobles in the dining room CTY_Main_A -248; 25; -512)Interact with any of the nobles, then follow them outside3) Interact with a noble during the AD4) End second dialog and have them fight or leave5) Talk to Noble 2

001_PostDuel.synopsis: Two nobles in Jannath Estate argue and finally come to blows. This oneliner is for if AngryNoble_001 is the survivor or if both nobles were calmed down. This noble sold the fake painting.
001_PostDuel.how_to_trigger: 1) Players get close to arguing nobles in the dining room CTY_Main_A -248; 25; -512)Interact with any of the nobles, then follow them outside3) Interact with a noble during the AD4) End second dialog and have them fight or leave5) Talk to Noble 1

002_PostDuel_0.speaker: Sir Gorran Penghyst
002_PostDuel_0.text: He was a stubborn fool to the last.  All I wanted was a refund...
002_PostDuel_0.context: NodeContext: Bitter, tinged with sadness - didn't want to kill his friend.

002_PostDuel_1.speaker: Sir Gorran Penghyst
002_PostDuel_1.text: Everybody saw, the duel was of Lord Delwaer's making, not mine. I have nothing to be sorry for.
002_PostDuel_1.context: NodeContext: Bitter, tinged with sadness - didn't want to kill his friend.

002_PostDuel_2.speaker: Sir Gorran Penghyst
002_PostDuel_2.text: Take my advice - never buy from your friends. Very hard to get a refund.

002_PostDuel_3.speaker: Sir Gorran Penghyst
002_PostDuel_3.text: A shame. I was rather in the mood for a spot of fisticuffs.

001_PostDuel_0.speaker: Lord Delwaer Jeth
001_PostDuel_0.text: I suppose I shall have to tell Gorran's husband. He'll be devastated.
001_PostDuel_0.context: NodeContext: Bitter, hint of sadness - didn't mean for it to come to this

001_PostDuel_1.speaker: Lord Delwaer Jeth
001_PostDuel_1.text: That's the last time I try to do a friend a favour. The ingratitude...

001_PostDuel_2.speaker: Lord Delwaer Jeth
001_PostDuel_2.text: Gorran should have left it alone. He never did know when to accept defeat.
001_PostDuel_2.context: NodeContext: Bitter, hint of sadness - didn't mean for it to come to this

001_PostDuel_3.speaker: Lord Delwaer Jeth
001_PostDuel_3.text: I'm hardly to blame if some people have more money than sense. Or in Gorran's case, a deficit of both.
